page.title: 08Fyfield Craft Workshops
page.content: On the site of the old maintenance yard still owned by St.John's College several men carry on small businesses. Mr.Hughes makes headboards and bedlegs.Some of his timber is stored in a falling down tithe barn and old stables. Mr.Bye from North Hinksey is a woodcarver and cabinet maker.He has worked here for twelve years and purchases his wood from Timbmets, Cumnor Hill.He makes furniture and wall panels for the college and exports pieces all over the world. He made the font and altar rail at Kingston Bagpuize Church. In a complex of four units built eighteen months ago,there is a caterer,a wardrobe maker, Mr.Axtell who manufactures fencing panels and Mr.Stallard who with the help of an apprentice rebinds law books.
